content:
As Liam got home, he could feel his face burning with embarrassment and anger. He slammed the door shut and threw his backpack across the room, feeling a sudden surge of rage like he had never experienced before.

He paced back and forth, his thoughts swirling with anger and humiliation. He couldn't believe that he had been made a laughingstock in front of the entire school, and he couldn't shake the feeling that everyone was talking about him behind his back.

Liam's fists clenched and unclenched as he struggled to control his emotions. He wanted to lash out, to scream and yell and break something, but he knew that would only make things worse.

Instead, he collapsed onto his bed, tears streaming down his face. He felt helpless and alone, like there was no one he could turn to for comfort or support. He wondered if he would ever be able to face his classmates again, or if he would be forever marked as the kid who couldn't even keep his pants from ripping.

For hours, Liam lay there in a daze, his mind consumed by thoughts of shame and anger. It wasn't until later that night, when his mom came home and found him sobbing, that he finally opened up about what had happened. It was the beginning of a long journey of healing and learning to cope with his emotions.
